message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.MM

The paper discusses the development of a virtual human journalist that utilizes natural language processing, computer vision, and speech synthesis. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC), Computation and Language (cs.CL), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV), and Multimedia (cs.MM). However, given the focus on natural communication and emotional engagement, we believe that Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) is the most likely sub-category. Computation and Language (cs.CL) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) are also likely given the use of natural language processing and speech synthesis. Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) and Multimedia (cs.MM) are less likely but still possible given the use of computer vision in creating the virtual human journalist.
